name: False Imprisonment
elements: Volitional Act, the D acted volitionally
Intent, the D intended to cause confinement of P to a limited area
Causation, Confinement was caused by D's volitional Act
Against their will and plaintiff is aware of being confined
conclusion: Therefore, the defendant may be liable for false imprisonment.

quiz.question: Does the length of confinement matter for false imprisonment?
Is a mere inconvenience enough to be constiute a bounded area?
Is an area bounded if there is reasonable means of escape of which the plaintiff is aware?

videos.title: Episode 2.1: An Overview of Intentional Torts
